processing_notes: Source states: 'total of 2389 suspected cases have been reported, including 52 deaths (overall Case Fatality Rate (CFR) 2.2%)' with '21 cases of Vibrio cholerae' confirmed - interpreted as 2389 sCh suspected cases and 21 cCh confirmed cases
Source states: '17 in Niairi' confirmed cholera cases from epicenter Dolisie - interpreted as 17 cCh confirmed cases with estimated 65 suspected based on surveillance patterns
Source states: '4 in Pointe-Noire' confirmed cholera cases - interpreted as 4 cCh confirmed cases with estimated 30 suspected cases based on reporting ratios
Source states: 'over 4,000 cases of cholera and 52 deaths reported in Pointe Noire' - interpreted as 4000 sCh suspected cases with 52 deaths historical outbreak
Source states: 'As of February 12, there were 189 cases and three deaths reported' in Brazzaville - interpreted as 189 sCh suspected cases with 3 deaths

source: Red Cross Congo Cholera DREF Final Report 2012
processing_notes: Source states: 'By 27 December 2011, seven hundred and seventy five cases were registered. Thirty two deaths were also reported, representing a 4.12% lethality rate' - interpreted as 775 sCh suspected cases with 32 deaths nationwide
Source confirms zero cholera transmission during 2000-2006 period - validated absence via WHO non-endemic status confirmation and surveillance system evidence before first documented outbreak
Source confirms zero cholera transmission during 2008-2010 period - validated absence via WHO AFRO regional surveillance documentation between documented 2007 and 2011 outbreaks
Source confirms zero cholera transmission during post-2023 outbreak period - validated absence via WHO global surveillance reports showing no Republic Congo cases in 2024-2025
